locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explains the historical context of Zechariah, the vulnerability of ancient cities, and the human desire for protection (children, health, reputation).
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong historical-grammatical grounding; uses the 'measuring rod' and 'wall of fire' imagery effectively to bridge history and contemporary anxiety.

illocutie.beschrijving: The sermon moves from describing human helplessness (Assertive) to invoking and declaring God's protective presence (Commissive/Declarative).
voorbeelden: The Lord will be a wall of fire round about the city
May the Lord keep you in the hollow of his hand

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Comfort, surrender of control, and a sense of divine security amidst vulnerability.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit; the preacher acts as a conduit for the 'angelic' message, but the Spirit is not explicitly named as the agent of the word's effect.

voorbeelden: Dallas is a city that has become a major metropolis.
The speaker of our text, Zechariah, prophesied at the time...
Great cities are not naturally safe places.
You have to turn them loose.
Stand still and see the salvation of the Lord.
I happened to sit next to a man...
I would rather my hand be cut off...
The Lord will make perfect that which concerneth us.
He shall give his angels charge over thee.
commissieven.kwaliteit: High; the preacher quotes Scripture as a direct promise from God to the listener.

voorbeelden: May the Lord keep you in the hollow of his hand.
May he defend you from enemies seen and unseen.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher assumes a benedictory authority at the conclusion, shifting from 'talking about' to 'imparting'.

indicatoren: Historical lecture on the Great Wall of China
Detailed exegesis of 587 B.C. Babylonian captivity
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is an observer of history and sociology for the first half of the sermon.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Delayed encounter; the 'event' only happens in the final third.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Strongly scriptural, though often framed as 'we can ask' rather than 'God does'.
voorbeelden: The Lord will be a wall of fire round about the city.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Anecdotal ('I sat next to') and homiletical ('I tell you').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the congregation's anxieties (children, health).
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used heavily in the closing benediction.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Historical and illustrative ('The man of wealth', 'The eagle', 'The prophet').
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a long 'runway' before the personal address begins.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: History of Jerusalem and personal anecdotes.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about life being a wheel and human helplessness.

actueel_present.gebruik: The concluding blessing and the 'now' of the millennium.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the history of walls (Assertive) to the promise of God's fire (Commissive) to the final blessing (Declarative).
voorbeelden: Zechariah said... (Assertive) -> The Lord will be a wall... (Commissive) -> May the Lord keep you... (Declarative)
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition is late but powerful.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: The Lord will be a wall... (Indicative) -> Just lean (Imperative).

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions primarily to offer comfort through the promise of God's protection, though it spends significant time in the 'constative' mode of storytelling.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord will make perfect that which concerneth us.
sterke_punten.effect: Provides a solid ground for faith.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The first three paragraphs are entirely secular/historical anecdotes.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event in the final third when the preacher stops talking about walls and starts blessing the people.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The use of 'May the Lord' (Optative) is strong, but 'I declare you protected' (Declarative) would be stronger.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is quoted, but the preacher primarily acts as a witness to the text.
tekstueel_bewijs: I tell you what we can do!

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Low; the Spirit is not explicitly mentioned.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon treats the 'Promise' as the means of grace.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: The 'wall of fire' imagery is epiphanic.
tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord will be a wall of fire round about the city.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on 'is' and 'was' (Assertives). It needs more 'I promise' and 'I declare' (Commissives/Declaratives).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The Lord will be a wall of fire.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: I announce to you today: God is your wall of fire.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a future-tense description to a present-tense reality.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is often framed as a historical quote.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Directly address the congregation with the promise.
voorbeeldzinnen: To you who are afraid for your children, God promises to be their wall.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much 'we' and 'they' in the first half.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'you' earlier to involve the hearer.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are sitting here today with walls you've built around your heart.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually quite good.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Maintain the 'lean' as the primary response to the 'wall'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A beautifully written sermon that successfully transitions into a performative event, though the 'runway' of talking about history is slightly too long.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT identifies that the preacher is not just sending a 'message' of comfort, but performing a 'blessing' that changes the hearer's status before God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power is not in the Dallas anecdote (rhetoric), but in the Commissive force of the Scripture quotes.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's climax is the shift from Assertive (history) to Declarative (benediction).

declaratief: may the God of hosts keep

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The Lord will be a wall of fire.

appendices.notities: The sermon follows a classic African-American homiletical move from information to celebration/blessing.
